translated: One aggregate is related to three aggregates and to materiality … Two aggregates are related to two aggregates … Applied thought is related to the materiality that is derived … The aggregates are related to the physical basis … The physical basis is related to the aggregates … Applied thought is related to the physical basis … The physical basis is related to applied thought … One great primary is related to three great primaries … The great primaries are related to the materiality that is derived, to the materiality that is inherent in the primaries, and to the materiality that is the result of nutriment … The external is related to the materiality that is derived, to the materiality that is the result of kamma, and to the materiality that is the result of consciousness … Nutriment-born is related to the materiality that is derived, to the materiality that is the result of kamma, to the materiality that is the result of consciousness, and to the materiality that is the result of temperature … Temperature-born is related to the materiality that is derived, to the materiality that is the result of kamma, to the materiality that is the result of consciousness, and to the materiality that is the result of nutriment … Non-percipient beings’ one great primary is related to the materiality that is derived, to the materiality that is the result of kamma, to the materiality that is the result of consciousness, and to the materiality that is the result of temperature … The great primaries are related to the materiality that is derived, to the materiality that is inherent in the primaries, and to the materiality that is the result of temperature.🔽🔽Conascence condition means:🔽

original: Avitakkaavicāro dhammo savitakkasavicārassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu savitakkasavicārānaṁ khandhānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakka sa vicārassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayo paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu sa vitakka sa vicārānam khandhānam sahajāta paccayena paccayo
translated: One aggregate is the condition, by way of the condition being due to the presence of the aggregate, for three aggregates and for the materiality that is derived from the great primaries. … Two aggregates are the condition, by way of the condition being due to the presence of the aggregate, for two aggregates and for the materiality that is derived from the great primaries. … Applied thought is the condition, by way of the condition being due to the presence of the aggregate, for the materiality that is derived and for the materiality that is not derived. … The aggregates are the condition, by way of the condition being due to the presence of the physical basis, for the physical basis. … The physical basis is the condition, by way of the condition being due to the presence of the aggregate, for the aggregates. … Applied thought is the condition, by way of the condition being due to the presence of the physical basis, for the physical basis. … The physical basis is the condition, by way of the condition being due to the presence of applied thought, for applied thought. … One great primary is the condition, by way of the condition being due to the presence of the great primaries, for three great primaries and for the materiality that is derived from the great primaries. … The great primaries are the condition, by way of the condition being due to the presence of the great primaries, for the materiality that is derived and for the materiality that is not derived. … An external great primary is the condition, by way of the condition being due to the presence of the great primaries, for the materiality that is derived and for the materiality that is not derived. … Nutriment as food is the condition, by way of the condition being due to the presence of the great primaries, for the materiality that is derived and for the materiality that is not derived. … Temperature is the condition, by way of the condition being due to the presence of the great primaries, for the materiality that is derived and for the materiality that is not derived. … One great primary in the case of the non-percipient beings is the condition, by way of the condition being due to the presence of the great primaries, for the materiality that is derived and for the materiality that is not derived. … The great primaries are the condition, by way of the condition being due to the presence of the great primaries, for the materiality that is derived and for the materiality that is not derived.🔽A state that is

original: Avitakkaavicāro dhammo avitakkavicāramattassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo—vicāro🔽avitakkavicāramattānaṁ khandhānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe vicāro🔽avitakkavicāramattānaṁ khandhānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu
analyzed: avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ avitakka vicāra mattassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ vicāro  avitakka vicāra mattānam khandhānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe vicāro  avitakka vicāra mattānam khandhānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu
translated: A state that is without thought and without examination is a condition, by way of conascence condition, for a state that is without thought and with examination, (that is,) for examination.

original: avitakkavicāramattānaṁ khandhānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu
analyzed: avitakka vicāra mattānam khandhānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu
translated: Examination is a condition, by way of conascence condition, for the states that are without thought and with examination. At the stage of rebirth-linking examination is a condition, by way of conascence condition, for the states that are without thought and with examination. At the stage of rebirth-linking the basis is a condition, by way of conascence condition, for the states that are without thought and with examination. At the stage of rebirth-linking the basis is a condition, by way of conascence condition, for examination.

original: vitakkassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakkaavicāro dhammo avitakkavicāramattassa ca avitakkaavicārassa ca dhammassa🔽sahajātapaccayena paccayo—vicāro avitakkavicāramattānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca
analyzed: vitakkassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ  avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ avitakka vicāra mattassa ca avitakka avicārassa ca dhammassa  sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ vicāraḥ a vitakka vicāra mattānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca
translated: Examination is a condition, by way of conascence condition, for thought.🔽A state that is without thought and without examination is a condition, by way of conascence condition, for a state that is without thought and with examination and for a state that is without thought and without examination, (that is,) for examination and for the states that are without thought and with examination and for the form that is derived from the four great elements.

original: rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe vicāro avitakkavicāramattānaṁ
analyzed: rūpānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe vicāraḥ
translated: At the stage of rebirth-linking examination is a condition, by way of conascence condition, for the states that are without thought and with examination and for the form that is derived from the four great elements.

original: khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu avitakkavicāramattānaṁ
analyzed: khandhānam kaṭattā ca rūpānam pe paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu
translated: At the mind-element and the mind-consciousness element that are without thought and with only a little investigation, the mind element and the mind-consciousness element are related to the mind-contact that is with thought and with investigation and to the mind-contact that is without thought and with only a little investigation as a condition being related to a condition that is a support.

original: khandhānaṁ vicārassa ca sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhānam vicārassa ca sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: At the mind-element and the mind-consciousness element that are without thought and with only a little investigation, the mind element and the mind-consciousness element are related to the investigation that is with thought and with investigation and to the investigation that is without thought and with only a little investigation as a condition being related to a condition that is a support.

original: Avitakkaavicāro dhammo savitakkasavicārassa ca avitakkavicāramattassa ca dhammassa🔽sahajātapaccayena paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu savitakkasavicārānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: avitakka avicāraḥ dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa ca avitakka vicāra mattassa ca dhammassa  sahajāta paccayena paccaya upaṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu sa vitakka sa vicārānam khandhānam
translated: A state that is without thought and without investigation is related to a state that is with thought and with investigation and to a state that is without thought and with only a little investigation as a condition being related to a condition that is a support.

original: vitakkassa ca sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vitakkassa ca sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: At the mind-element and the mind-consciousness element that are without thought and with only a little investigation, the mind element and the mind-consciousness element are related to the thought that is with thought and with investigation and to the investigation that is without thought and with only a little investigation as a condition being related to a condition that is a support.

original: Savitakkasavicāro ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena🔽paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe savitakkasavicāro eko khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāro ca avitakka avicāro ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena  paccaya upaṭisandhi khaṇe sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam
translated: A state that is with thought and with investigation and a state that is without thought and without investigation are related to a state that is with thought and with investigation as a condition being related to a condition that is a support.🔽At the stage of arising, a state that is with thought and with investigation and the mind-object are related to the three aggregates that are with thought and with investigation as a condition being related to a condition that is a support.

original: sahajātapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā ca vatthu ca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā ca vatthu ca dvinnam khandhānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … Two aggregates and the mind-object are related to the two aggregates as a condition being related to a condition that is a support.

original: Savitakkasavicāro ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā avitakkavicāramattassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ca avitakka avicāraḥ ca dhammā avitakka vicāra mattassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena
translated: States that are both accompanied by applied thought and accompanied by sustained thought and states that are neither accompanied by applied thought nor accompanied by sustained thought are a condition, as conascence condition, for states that are accompanied by applied thought and are not accompanied by sustained thought.

original: paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe savitakkasavicārā khandhā ca vatthu ca vitakkassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccaya upaṭisandhi khaṇe sa vitakka sa vicārā khandhā ca vatthu ca vitakkassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The condition being fulfilled, the states that are accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and the physical basis are a condition, as conascence condition, for applied thought.

original: Savitakkasavicāro ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā avitakkaavicārassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena🔽paccayo—savitakkasavicārā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ca avitakka avicāraḥ ca dhammā avitakka avicārassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena  paccaya usa vitakka sa vicārā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam sahajāta paccayena
translated: States that are both accompanied by applied thought and accompanied by sustained thought and states that are neither accompanied by applied thought nor accompanied by sustained thought are a condition, as conascence condition, for states that are not accompanied by applied thought and are not accompanied by sustained thought.🔽The condition being fulfilled, the states that are accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and the great primaries are a condition, as conascence condition, for the kinds of materiality derived from the great primaries.

original: paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe savitakkasavicārā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca kaṭattārūpānaṁ🔽sahajātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Savitakkasavicāro ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa ca avitakkavicāramattassa
analyzed: paccayo paṭisandhi kkhaṇe sa vitakka sa vicārā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca kaṭattā rūpāna  sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ  sa vitakka sa vicāro ca avitakka avicāro ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa ca avitakka vicāra mattassa
translated: The condition being fulfilled, the states that are accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and the great primaries are a condition, as conascence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness and for the kinds of materiality due to kamma performed.

original: ca dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo— paṭisandhikkhaṇe savitakkasavicāro eko khandho
analyzed: ca dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ekaḥ khandho
translated: States that are both accompanied by applied thought and accompanied by sustained thought and states that are neither accompanied by applied thought nor accompanied by sustained thought are a condition, as conascence condition, for states that are accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and for states that are accompanied by applied thought and are not accompanied by sustained thought.🔽The condition being fulfilled, the states that are accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and the great primaries are a condition, as conascence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness and for the kinds of materiality due to kamma performed.

original: ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ vitakkassa ca …pe… dve khandhā ca vatthu ca dvinnaṁ
analyzed: ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam vitakkassa ca pe dve khandhā ca vatthu ca dvinnam
translated: and the basis are of three kinds of aggregates and of applied thought …🔽and the basis are of two kinds of aggregates and of two kinds of consciousness.

original: khandhānaṁ vitakkassa ca sahajātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakkavicāramatto ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: khandhānam vitakkassa ca sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ  avitakka vicāra mattaḥ ca avitakka avicāro ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena
translated: and the physical basis are a condition, by way of a support condition, for three aggregates and for applied thought. … Two aggregates and the physical basis are a condition, by way of a support condition, for two aggregates and for applied thought.🔽A state with applied thought and sustained thought and a state without applied thought but with sustained thought are a condition, by way of a support condition, for a state with applied thought and sustained thought.

original: paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vitakko ca vatthu ca savitakkasavicārānaṁ khandhānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakkavicāramatto ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā avitakkavicāramattassa dhammassa
analyzed: paccaya upaṭisandhi khaṇe vitakkaḥ ca vatthu ca sa vitakka sa vicārānam khandhānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ  avitakka vicāra matto ca avitakka avicāro ca dhammā avitakka vicāra mattassa dhammassa
translated: A state with applied thought and sustained thought and a state without applied thought but with sustained thought are a condition, by way of a support condition, for a state without applied thought and without sustained thought.🔽A state with applied thought and sustained thought and a state without applied thought but with sustained thought are a condition, by way of a support condition, for a state without applied thought and without sustained thought.

original: sahajātapaccayena paccayo—avitakkavicāramatto eko khandho ca vicāro ca tiṇṇannaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ …pe… dve khandhā ca vicāro ca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vicāro ca  khandhānam pe dve khandhā ca vicāro ca dvinnam khandhānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state with applied thought and sustained thought and a state without applied thought but with sustained thought are a condition, by way of a support condition, for a state without applied thought and without sustained thought.

original: Paṭisandhikkhaṇe avitakkavicāramatto eko khandho ca vicāro ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: paṭisandhi kkhaṇe avitakka vicāra matto ekaḥ khandho ca vicāro ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam
translated: A state with applied thought and sustained thought and a state without applied thought but with sustained thought are a condition, by way of a support condition, for a state without applied thought and without sustained thought.

original: …pe… dve khandhā ca vicāro ca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe avitakkavicāramatto
analyzed: pe dve khandhā ca vicāro ca dvinnam khandhānam pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe a vitakka vicāra matto
translated: … the two aggregates and applied thought are related to two aggregates … At the stage of rebirth-linking …🔽one aggregate and the physical basis are related to three aggregates as conascence condition.🔽The two aggregates of non-percipient beings and the physical basis are related to the non-percipient-being aggregate as conascence condition.

original: eko khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ekaḥ khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The two aggregates of non-percipient beings and the physical basis are related to the non-percipient-being physical basis as conascence condition.🔽The two aggregates of non-percipient beings and the great primaries are related to the non-percipient-being physical basis as conascence condition.🔽The two aggregates of non-percipient beings and the great primaries are related to the non-percipient-being materiality derived from the great primaries as conascence condition.

original: Avitakkavicāramatto ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā avitakkaavicārassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena🔽paccayo—avitakkavicāramattā khandhā ca vicāro ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: avitakka vicāra mattaḥ ca avitakka avicāro ca dhammā avitakka avicārassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena  paccayo a vitakka vicāra mattā khandhāḥ ca vicāro ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam sahajāta paccayena
translated: The two aggregates of non-percipient beings and applied thought are related to the non-percipient-being materiality originated by consciousness as conascence condition.🔽The two aggregates of non-percipient beings and the great primaries are related to the non-percipient-being materiality originated by consciousness as conascence condition.🔽The two aggregates of non-percipient beings and applied thought are related to the non-percipient-being materiality originated by consciousness as conascence condition.🔽The two aggregates of non-percipient beings and the great primaries are related to the non-percipient-being materiality originated by consciousness as conascence condition.

original: paccayo. Avitakkavicāramattā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ …pe…
analyzed: paccayaḥ a vitakka vicāra mattā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam pe
translated: The two aggregates of non-percipient beings and applied thought are related to the non-percipient-being materiality originated by consciousness as conascence condition.🔽The two aggregates of non-percipient beings and the great primaries are related to the non-percipient-being materiality originated by consciousness as conascence condition.🔽The two aggregates of non-percipient beings and applied thought are related to the non-percipient-being materiality originated by consciousness as conascence condition.

original: vitakko ca mahābhūtā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe avitakkavicāramattā
analyzed: vitakko ca mahābhūtā ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe a vitakka vicāra mattā
translated: The two aggregates of non-percipient beings and the great primaries are related to the non-percipient-being materiality originated by consciousness as conascence condition.

original: khandhā ca vicāro ca kaṭattārūpānaṁ …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe avitakkavicāramattā khandhā
analyzed: khandhā ca vicāro ca kaṭattā rūpānam pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe a vitakka vicāra mattā khandhā
translated: The two aggregates of non-percipient beings and applied thought are related to the non-percipient-being materiality originated by consciousness as conascence condition.🔽The two aggregates of non-percipient beings and the great primaries are related to the non-percipient-being materiality originated by consciousness as con

original: ca mahābhūtā ca kaṭattārūpānaṁ …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe vitakko ca mahābhūtā ca kaṭattārūpānaṁ
analyzed: ca mahābhūtā ca kaṭattā rūpānaṃ pe paṭisandhi khaṇe vitakko ca mahābhūtā ca kaṭattā rūpānaṃ
translated: The four great elements and the form derived from the great elements that arise with applied thought at the moment of rebirth-linking are related to that applied thought as the simultaneous support condition.

original: …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe avitakkavicāramattā khandhā ca vatthu ca vicārassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakkavicāramatto ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā avitakkavicāramattassa ca avitakkaavicārassa🔽ca dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo—avitakkavicāramatto eko khandho ca vicāro
analyzed: pe paṭisandhi khaṇe avitakka vicāra mattā khandhā ca vatthu ca vicārassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ  avitakka vicāra matto ca avitakka avicāro ca dhammā avitakka vicāra mattassa ca avitakka avicārassa  ca dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vicāro
translated: … The three remaining aggregates and the physical basis are related to applied thought as the simultaneous support condition.🔽The three remaining aggregates and the physical basis are related to applied thought and sustained thought as the simultaneous support condition.

original: ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo. Tayo🔽khandhā ca vicāro ca ekassa khandhassa cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānam sahajāta paccayena paccayo tayo  khandhā ca vicāraḥ ca ekassa khandhassa citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam sahajāta paccayena
translated: One of the three remaining aggregates and sustained thought are related to the three remaining aggregates and to the form that is derived form as the simultaneous support condition.🔽Two of the three remaining aggregates and sustained thought are related to the one remaining aggregate and to the form that is derived form as the simultaneous support condition.

original: paccayo. Dve khandhā ca vicāro ca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ
analyzed: paccayaḥ dve khandhā ca vicāro ca dvinnam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam
translated: Two of the three remaining aggregates and sustained thought are related to the two remaining aggregates and to the form that is derived form as the simultaneous support condition.

original: sahajātapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe avitakkavicāramatto eko khandho ca vicāro
analyzed: sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vicāro
translated: They are a condition, as a co-nascence condition, for the three aggregates that are conjoined with consciousness and for the kinds of materiality that are con-comitant with mind.🔽They are a condition, as a co-nascence condition, for the two aggregates and for the kinds of materiality that are con-comitant with mind.🔽They are a condition, as a co-nascence condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality that are con-comitant with mind.

original: ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā🔽…pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe avitakkavicāramatto eko khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ🔽vicārassa ca sahajātapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā ca vatthu ca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam kaṭattā ca rūpānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā  pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe avitakka vicāra matto ekaḥ khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam  vicārassa ca sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā ca vatthu ca dvinnam khandhānam
translated: They are a condition, as a co-nascence condition, for the two aggregates and for the kinds of materiality that are con-comitant with mind.🔽They are a condition, as a co-nascence condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality that are con-comitant with mind.🔽They are a condition, as a co-nascence condition, for the two aggregates and for the kinds of materiality that are con-comitant with mind.🔽They are a condition, as a co-nascence condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality that are con-comitant with mind.

original: vicārassa ca sahajātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Savitakkasavicāro ca avitakkavicāramatto ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa dhammassa
analyzed: vicārassa ca sahajāta paccayena paccayo  sa vitakka sa vicāro ca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa dhammassa
translated: They are a condition, as a co-nascence condition, for the two aggregates and for the kinds of materiality that are con-comitant with mind.🔽They are a condition, as a co-nascence condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality that are con-comitant with mind.🔽They are a condition, as a co-nascence condition, for the two aggregates and for the kinds of materiality that are con-comitant with mind.🔽They are a condition, as a co-nascence condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality that are con-comitant with mind.

original: sahajātapaccayena paccayo—savitakkasavicāro eko khandho ca vitakko ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: sahajāta paccayena paccayo sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vitakkaḥ ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam
translated: They are a condition, as a co-nascence condition, for the two aggregates and for the kinds of materiality that are con-comitant with mind.🔽They are a condition, as a co-nascence condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality that are con-comitant with mind.🔽They are a condition, as a co-nascence condition, for the two aggregates and for the kinds of materiality that are con-comitant with mind.

original: sahajātapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā ca vitakko ca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ sahajātapaccayena🔽paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā ca vitakko ca dvinnam khandhānam sahajāta paccayena 🔽paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: They are a condition, as a co-nascence condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality that are con-comitant

original: Savitakkasavicāro ca avitakkavicāramatto ca dhammā avitakkaavicārassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ca avitakka vicāra matto ca dhammā avitakka avicārassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena
translated: States that are accompanied by applied and sustained thought and states that are accompanied by sustained thought but not by applied thought are a condition, as conascence condition, for states that are not accompanied by applied and sustained thought.

original: paccayo—savitakkasavicārā khandhā ca vitakko ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: paccaya usa vitakka sa vicārā khandhā ca vitakko ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam sahajāta paccayena
translated: The states that are accompanied by applied and sustained thought and applied thought are a condition, as conascence condition, for the kinds of materiality derived from the four great primaries.

original: paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Savitakkasavicāro ca avitakkavicāramatto ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa ca avitakkaavicārassa
analyzed: paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe  sa vitakka sa vicāro ca avitakka vicāra matto ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa ca avitakka avicārassa
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: ca dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo—savitakkasavicāro eko khandho ca vitakko ca
analyzed: ca dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayo sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vitakko ca
translated: States that are accompanied by applied and sustained thought and states that are accompanied by sustained thought but not by applied thought are a condition, as conascence condition, for states that are accompanied by applied and sustained thought and for states that are not accompanied by applied and sustained thought.

original: tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo …pe…
analyzed: tiṇṇannam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ pe
translated: One of the aggregates that is accompanied by applied and sustained thought and applied thought are a condition, as conascence condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived from the four great primaries. …

original: dve khandhā ca vitakko ca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena🔽paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: dve khandhā ca vitakko ca dvinnam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam sahajāta paccayena  paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: Two of the aggregates and applied thought are a condition, as conascence condition, for the two aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived from the four great primaries.🔽At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Savitakkasavicāro ca avitakkavicāramatto ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāro ca avitakka vicāra matto ca avitakka avicāro ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa
translated: States that are accompanied by applied and sustained thought and states that are accompanied by sustained thought but not by applied thought and states that are not accompanied by applied and sustained thought are a condition, as conascence condition, for states that are accompanied by applied and sustained thought.

original: dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe savitakkasavicāro eko khandho
analyzed: dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccaya upaṭisandhi khaṇe sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ekaḥ khandho
translated: A state that is associated with applied thought is a condition, by way of the condition being conascence, for the three aggregates that are not associated with applied thought.

original: ca vitakko ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā🔽ca vitakko ca vatthu ca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ca vitakko ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā  ca vitakko ca vatthu ca dvinnam khandhānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Two aggregates that are associated with applied thought and the basis are a condition, by way of the condition being conascence, for the two aggregates that are not associated with applied thought.

original: Savitakkasavicāro ca avitakkavicāramatto ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā avitakkaavicārassa
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ca avitakka vicāra matto ca avitakka avicāro ca dhammā avitakka avicārassa
translated: A state that is associated with applied thought and a state that is without applied thought but with sustained thought and a state that is without applied thought and without sustained thought are a condition, by way of the condition being conascence, for a state that is without applied thought and without sustained thought.

original: dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo—savitakkasavicārā khandhā ca vitakko ca mahābhūtā🔽ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe savitakkasavicārā
analyzed: dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayo sa vitakka sa vicārā khandhā ca vitakko ca mahābhūtā  ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe sa vitakka sa vicārā
translated: The aggregates that are associated with applied thought and sustained thought and applied thought and the great primaries🔽are a condition, by way of the condition being conascence, for the form that is derived from the great primaries. At the stage of rebirth-linking, the aggregates that are associated with applied thought and sustained thought and applied thought and the great primaries

original: khandhā ca vitakko ca mahābhūtā ca kaṭattārūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhā ca vitakko ca mahābhūtā ca kaṭattā rūpānam sahajāta paccayena paccayo
translated: are a condition, by way of the condition being conascence, for the form that is derived from the great primaries.

original: Aññamañña
analyzed: aññamañña
translated: Mutually

original: Savitakkasavicāro dhammo savitakkasavicārassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—savitakkasavicāro
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakka sa vicārassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ
translated: A state that is associated with applied thought is a condition, by way of the condition being mutuality, for a state that is associated with applied thought.

original: eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: ekaḥ khandhaḥ tiṇṇannam khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: One of the aggregates is a condition, by way of mutual conditionality, for three of the aggregates. …🔽At the time of rebirth-linking,

original: savitakkasavicāro eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe…
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ekaḥ khandho tiṇṇannam khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe
translated: a state with applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, by way of mutual conditionality, for three of the aggregates. …

original: dve khandhā dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.🔽Savitakkasavicāro dhammo avitakkavicāramattassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—savitakkasavicārā khandhā vitakkassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Savitakkasavicāro dhammo avitakkaavicārassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe savitakkasavicārā khandhā vatthussa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: dve khandhāḥ dvinnam khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ  sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ dhammaḥ avitakka vicāra mattassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccayo sa vitakka sa vicārāḥ khandhāḥ vitakkassa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe  sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ dhammaḥ avitakka avicārassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccayo upaṭisandhi khaṇe sa vitakka sa vicārāḥ khandhāḥ vatthussa aññamañña paccayena paccayo
translated: Two of the aggregates are a condition, by way of mutual conditionality, for two of the aggregates.🔽A state with applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, by way of mutual conditionality, for a state without applied thought but with sustained thought only: the aggregates with applied thought and sustained thought are a condition, by way of mutual conditionality, for applied thought. At the time of rebirth-linking …🔽A state with applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, by way of mutual conditionality, for a state without applied thought and without sustained thought: at the time of rebirth-linking, the aggregates with applied thought and sustained thought are a condition, by way of mutual conditionality, for the physical basis.

original: Savitakkasavicāro dhammo savitakkasavicārassa ca avitakkaavicārassa ca dhammassa
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa ca avitakka avicārassa ca dhammassa
translated: A state with applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, by way of mutual conditionality, for a state with applied thought and sustained thought and for a state without applied thought and without sustained thought.

original: aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe savitakkasavicāro eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ
analyzed: aññamañña paccayena paccaya upaṭisandhi kkhaṇe sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ekaḥ khandho
translated: Mutually as condition: At the time of rebirth-linking, one of the aggregates that is with thought and examination is, as the basis, mutually as condition for the other three aggregates.

original: khandhānaṁ vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ🔽vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhānam vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā dvinnam khandhānam  vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Two of the aggregates are, as the basis, mutually as condition for the two other aggregates.

original: Savitakkasavicāro dhammo avitakkavicāramattassa ca avitakkaavicārassa ca dhammassa
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ dhammaḥ avitakka vicāra mattassa ca avitakka avicārassa ca dhammassa
translated: A state that is with thought and examination is mutually as condition for a state that is without thought and with only examination and for a state that is without thought and without examination.

original: aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe savitakkasavicārā khandhā vitakkassa🔽ca vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.🔽Savitakkasavicāro dhammo savitakkasavicārassa ca avitakkavicāramattassa ca dhammassa🔽aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—savitakkasavicāro eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ vitakkassa
analyzed: aññamañña paccayena paccaya upaṭisandhi kkhaṇe sa vitakka sa vicārāḥ khandhāḥ vitakkassa  ca vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ  sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa ca avitakka vicāra mattassa ca dhammassa  aññamañña paccayena paccaya usa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ekaḥ khandho tiṇṇannam khandhānam vitakkassa
translated: At the time of rebirth-linking, the aggregates that are with thought and examination are, as the basis, mutually as condition for thought.🔽A state that is with thought and examination is mutually as condition for a state that is with thought and examination and for a state that is without thought and with only examination.🔽One of the aggregates that is with thought and examination is, as the basis, mutually as condition for the other three aggregates and for thought.

original: ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ vitakkassa ca aññamaññapaccayena
analyzed: ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā dvinnam khandhānam vitakkassa ca aññamañña paccayena
translated: Two of the aggregates that are with thought and examination are, as the basis, mutually as condition for the two other aggregates and for thought.

original: paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Savitakkasavicāro dhammo savitakkasavicārassa ca avitakkavicāramattassa ca avitakkaavicārassa🔽ca dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe savitakkasavicāro eko khandho
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa ca avitakka vicāra mattassa ca avitakka avicārassa  ca dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccaya upaṭisandhi kkhaṇe sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ekaḥ khandho
translated: A state with applied thought and sustained thought is an immediately preceding condition, a support condition, and a prenascence condition for a state with applied thought and sustained thought, for a state with applied thought and without sustained thought, and for a state with neither applied thought nor sustained thought.

original: tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ vitakkassa ca vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve🔽khandhā dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ vitakkassa ca vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakkavicāramatto dhammo avitakkavicāramattassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—avitakkavicāramatto🔽eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā dvinnaṁ
analyzed: tiṇṇannam khandhānam vitakkassa ca vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve  khandhāḥ dvinnam khandhānam vitakkassa ca vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ  a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammaḥ a vitakka vicāra mattassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ  ekaḥ khandhaḥ tiṇṇannam khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhāḥ dvinnam
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking, one of the aggregates with applied thought and sustained thought is an immediately preceding condition, a support condition, and a prenascence condition for the three aggregates and for applied thought and for the materiality of the physical basis. … Two aggregates are …🔽A state with applied thought and without sustained thought is an immediately preceding condition, a support condition, and a prenascence condition for a state with applied thought and without sustained thought, for a state with neither applied thought nor sustained thought, and for a state with applied thought and without sustained thought.

original: khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe
translated: A state with applied thought and without sustained thought is an immediately preceding condition, a support condition, and a prenascence condition for a state with neither applied thought nor sustained thought.🔽At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Avitakkavicāramatto dhammo savitakkasavicārassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—vitakko savitakkasavicārānaṁ khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Avitakkavicāramatto dhammo avitakkaavicārassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—avitakkavicāramattā🔽khandhā vicārassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe avitakkavicāramattā
analyzed: avitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakka sa vicārassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ vitakkaḥ sa vitakka sa vicārānam khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe  avitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammaḥ avitakka avicārassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ avitakka vicāra mattā  khandhāḥ vicārassa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe a vitakka vicāra mattā
translated: A state that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, by way of mutual conditionality, for a state that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought. Applied thought is a condition, by way of mutual conditionality, for the aggregates that are accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought. At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: khandhā vicārassa ca vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe vitakko🔽vatthussa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakkavicāramatto dhammo savitakkasavicārassa ca avitakkaavicārassa ca dhammassa🔽aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vitakko savitakkasavicārānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: khandhāḥ vicārassa ca vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vitakko  vatthussa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ  a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa ca avitakka avicārassa ca dhammassa  aññamañña paccayena paccaya upaṭisandhi kkhaṇe vitakko sa vitakka sa vicārānam khandhānam
translated: A state that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, by way of mutual conditionality, for a state that is free from applied thought and sustained thought. The aggregates that are accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought are a condition, by way of mutual conditionality, for sustained thought. At the moment of rebirth-linking, the aggregates that are accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought are a condition, by way of mutual conditionality, for sustained thought and for the physical basis. At the moment of rebirth-linking, applied thought is a condition, by way of mutual conditionality, for the physical basis.

original: vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, by way of mutual conditionality, for a state that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and for a state that is free from applied thought and sustained thought. At the moment of rebirth-linking, applied thought is a condition, by way of mutual conditionality, for the aggregates that are accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and for the physical basis.

original: Avitakkavicāramatto dhammo avitakkavicāramattassa ca avitakkaavicārassa ca dhammassa🔽aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—avitakkavicāramatto eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ vicārassa
analyzed: a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammaḥ a vitakka vicāra mattassa ca a vitakka avicārassa ca dhammassa  aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ ekaḥ khandhaḥ tiṇṇannam khandhānam vicārassa
translated: A state that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, as mutual condition, for a state that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and for a state that is without applied thought and sustained thought.🔽A single aggregate that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, as mutual condition, for the three aggregates that are without applied thought and sustained thought and for the applied thought and sustained thought that are without applied thought and sustained thought.

original: ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ vicārassa ca aññamaññapaccayena🔽paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe avitakkavicāramatto eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ vicārassa🔽ca vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ vicārassa
analyzed: ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā dvinnam khandhānam vicārassa ca aññamañña paccayena  paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe avitakka vicāra mattaḥ ekaḥ khandho tiṇṇannam khandhānam vicārassa  ca vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā dvinnam khandhānam vicārassa
translated: … Two aggregates are a condition, as mutual condition, for two aggregates and for the applied thought and sustained thought that are without applied thought and sustained thought.🔽At the moment of rebirth-linking, a single aggregate that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, as mutual condition, for the three aggregates that are without applied thought and sustained thought and for the physical basis that is without applied thought and sustained thought.🔽… Two aggregates are a condition, as mutual condition, for two aggregates and for the physical basis that is without applied thought and sustained thought.

original: ca vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakkaavicāro dhammo avitakkaavicārassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—avitakkaavicāro
analyzed: ca vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ  avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ avitakka avicārassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ avitakka avicāraḥ
translated: A state that is without applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, as mutual condition, for a state that is without applied thought and sustained thought.🔽A single aggregate that is without applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, as mutual condition, for the three aggregates that are without applied thought and sustained thought and for the applied thought and sustained thought that are without applied thought and sustained thought.

original: eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā dvinnaṁ
analyzed: ekaḥ khandhaḥ tiṇṇannam khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhāḥ dvinnam
translated: … Two aggregates are a condition, as mutual condition, for two aggregates and for the applied thought and sustained thought that are without applied thought and sustained thought.

original: khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe avitakkaavicāro eko khandho🔽tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā dvinnaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo. Khandhā vatthussa …pe… vatthu🔽khandhānaṁ …pe… vicāro vatthussa …pe… vatthu vicārassa …pe… ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ tiṇṇannaṁ
analyzed: khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe avitakka avicāraḥ ekaḥ khandho  tiṇṇannam khandhānam vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhāḥ dvinnam  khandhānam vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ khandhāḥ vatthussa pe vatthu  khandhānam pe vicāraḥ vatthussa pe vatthu vicārassa pe ekam mahābhūtam
translated: The other four aggregates are related to the aggregate of material form as a condition being originated by a condition.🔽At the moment of rebirth-linking, the aggregate of material form is related to the three aggregates as a condition being originated by a condition. …🔽Two aggregates are related to two aggregates as a condition being originated by a condition. The aggregates are related to the physical heart-basis as a condition being originated by a condition. … The physical heart-basis is related to the aggregates as a condition being originated by a condition. …🔽The physical heart-basis is related to applied thought as a condition being originated by a condition. … Applied thought is related to the physical heart-basis as a condition being originated by a condition. … One great primary is related to the other three as a condition being originated by a condition. …🔽

original: mahābhūtānaṁ …pe… bāhiraṁ … āhārasamuṭṭhānaṁ … utusamuṭṭhānaṁ … asaññasattānaṁ ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe….🔽Avitakkaavicāro dhammo savitakkasavicārassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu savitakkasavicārānaṁ khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: mahābhūtānam pe bāhiram āhāra samuṭṭhānam utu samuṭṭhānam asaññasattānam ekam mahābhūtam pe  avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakka sa vicārassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ upaṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu sa vitakka sa vicārānam khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The aggregates are related to each other as a condition by way of mutuality. At the time of rebirth-linking, the single aggregate without thinking and without exploring is related to the three aggregates as a condition by way of mutuality and to the physical basis. … Two aggregates are related to two aggregates as a condition by way of mutuality and to the physical basis. The aggregates are related to the physical basis … The physical basis is related to the aggregates … Exploring is related to the physical basis … The physical basis is related to exploring … One of the great essentials is related to the three great essentials … An external great essential … Arisen from nutriment … Arisen from temperature … One of the great essentials of the non-percipient beings …🔽A state without thinking and without exploring is related to a state with thinking and with exploring as a condition by way of mutuality. At the time of rebirth-linking, the physical basis is related to the aggregates with thinking and with exploring as a condition by way of mutuality.

original: Avitakkaavicāro dhammo avitakkavicāramattassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—vicāro
analyzed: avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ avitakka vicāra mattassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ vicāraḥ
translated: A state without thinking and without exploring is related to a state without thinking and with exploring only as a condition by way of mutuality. Exploring is related to the physical basis …

original: avitakkavicāramattānaṁ khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe vicāro🔽avitakkavicāramattānaṁ khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu
analyzed: a vitakka vicāra mattānam khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe vicāro  a vitakka vicāra mattānam khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu
translated: the other mind- and bodily-formations that are without thought and only with sustained thought are mutually related as object condition. At the time of rebirth-linking, sustained thought🔽the other mind- and bodily-formations that are without thought and only with sustained thought are mutually related as object condition. At the time of rebirth-linking, the physical basis🔽

original: avitakkavicāramattānaṁ khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu🔽vitakkassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakkaavicāro dhammo avitakkavicāramattassa ca avitakkaavicārassa ca dhammassa🔽aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vicāro avitakkavicāramattānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: a vitakka vicāra mattānam khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu  vitakkassa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ  avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ avitakka vicāra mattassa ca avitakka avicārassa ca dhammassa  aññamañña paccayena paccaya upaṭisandhi kkhaṇe vicāraḥ avitakka vicāramattānam khandhānam
translated: The states that are without thought and with only sustained thought are mutually related as condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking, sustained thought is related to the states that are without thought and with only sustained thought as condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking, the physical basis is related to the states that are without thought and with only sustained thought as condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking, the physical basis is related to the states that are without thought and with only sustained thought as condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking, the physical basis is related to thought as condition.🔽A state that is without thought and with sustained thought is related to a state that is without thought and with sustained thought, and to a state that is without thought and without sustained thought, as condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking, sustained thought is related to the states that are without thought and with sustained thought,

original: vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu avitakkavicāramattānaṁ
analyzed: vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu
translated: and to the physical basis, as condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking, the physical basis is related to the states that are without thought and with sustained thought,

original: khandhānaṁ vicārassa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhānam vicārassa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: and to sustained thought, as condition.

original: Avitakkaavicāro dhammo savitakkasavicārassa ca avitakkavicāramattassa ca dhammassa
analyzed: avitakka avicāraḥ dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa ca avitakka vicāra mattassa ca dhammassa
translated: A state that is without thought and with sustained thought is related to a state that is with thought and with sustained thought, and to a state that is without thought and with sustained thought, as condition.

original: aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu savitakkasavicārānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: aññamañña paccayena paccaya upaṭisandhi kkhaṇe vatthu sa vitakka sa vicārānam khandhānam
translated: Mutually as condition: At the time of rebirth-linking, the physical basis is mutually as condition for the thoughts and the thought-concomitants

original: vitakkassa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vitakkassa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: and for the thought.

original: Savitakkasavicāro ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena🔽paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe savitakkasavicāro eko khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ca avitakka avicāraḥ ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena  paccaya upaṭisandhi khaṇe sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam
translated: A state with applied thought and sustained thought and a state without applied thought but with sustained thought are mutually as condition for a state with applied thought and sustained thought.🔽At the time of rebirth-linking, one of the aggregates with applied thought and sustained thought and the physical basis are mutually as condition for the three aggregates …

original: …pe… dve khandhā ca vatthu ca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.🔽Savitakkasavicāro ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā avitakkavicāramattassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena🔽paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe savitakkasavicārā khandhā ca vatthu ca vitakkassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pe dve khandhā ca vatthu ca dvinnam khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ  sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ca avitakka avicāraḥ ca dhammā avitakka vicāra mattassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena  paccaya upaṭisandhi khaṇe sa vitakka sa vicārā khandhā ca vatthu ca vitakkassa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: two of the aggregates and the physical basis are mutually as condition for the two aggregates.🔽A state with applied thought and sustained thought and a state without applied thought but with sustained thought are mutually as condition for a state with applied thought and sustained thought and a state without applied thought but with sustained thought.

original: Savitakkasavicāro ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa ca avitakkavicāramattassa
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāro ca avitakka avicāro ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa ca avitakka vicāra mattassa
translated: At the time of rebirth-linking, the aggregates with applied thought and sustained thought and the physical basis are mutually as condition for the thought.

original: ca dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo— paṭisandhikkhaṇe savitakkasavicāro eko khandho🔽ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ vitakkassa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve
analyzed: ca dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ekaḥ khandho  ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam vitakkassa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking, the one aggregate that is accompanied by applied and sustained thought🔽and the physical basis are a condition, as mutual condition, for the three aggregates and for applied thought. … Two aggregates🔽and the physical basis are a condition, as mutual condition, for the two aggregates and for applied thought.

original: khandhā ca vatthu ca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ vitakkassa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakkavicāramatto ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena
analyzed: khandhā ca vatthu ca dvinnam khandhānam vitakkassa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ  avitakka vicāra matto ca avitakka avicāro ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena
translated: The state of consciousness that is accompanied by applied and sustained thought and the state of consciousness that is accompanied by neither applied nor sustained thought are a condition, as mutual condition, for the state of consciousness that is accompanied by applied thought but not by sustained thought.🔽At the moment of rebirth-linking, applied thought and the physical basis are a condition, as mutual condition, for the aggregates that are accompanied by applied and sustained thought.🔽The state of consciousness that is accompanied by applied and sustained thought and the state of consciousness that is accompanied by neither applied nor sustained thought are a condition, as mutual condition, for the state of consciousness that is accompanied by applied thought but not by sustained thought.

original: paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vitakko ca vatthu ca savitakkasavicārānaṁ khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakkavicāramatto ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā avitakkavicāramattassa dhammassa🔽aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—avitakkavicāramatto eko khandho ca vicāro ca tiṇṇannaṁ
analyzed: paccaya upaṭisandhi khaṇe vitakkaḥ ca vatthu ca sa vitakka sa vicārānam khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ 🔽avitakka vicāra matto ca avitakka avicāro ca dhammā avitakka vicāra mattassa dhammassa 🔽aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vicāro ca
translated: The one aggregate that is accompanied by applied and sustained thought and applied thought and sustained thought are a condition, as mutual condition, for the three aggregates that are accompanied by applied thought but not by sustained thought.

original: khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā ca vicāro ca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ🔽aññamaññapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe avitakkavicāramatto eko khandho ca vicāro
analyzed: khandhānaṃ aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā ca vicāro ca dvinnam khandhānam  aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vicāro
translated: The other four aggregates are related to each other as condition by way of condition being by way of prenascence condition, postnascence condition, and support condition.🔽Two aggregates and applied thought are related to two aggregates as condition by way of condition being by way of mutual condition.🔽At the consciousness moment of rebirth, one aggregate that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought, and applied thought, and the physical basis are related to three aggregates as condition by way of condition being by way of mutual condition.

original: ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ …pe… dve khandhā ca vicāro ca vatthu ca dvinnaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam pe dve khandhā ca vicāro ca vatthu ca dvinnam  khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Two aggregates and applied thought, and the physical basis are related to two aggregates as condition by way of condition being by way of mutual condition.

original: Avitakkavicāramatto ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā avitakkaavicārassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena
analyzed: avitakka vicāra mattaḥ ca avitakka avicāro ca dhammā avitakka avicārassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena
translated: Dhammas that are accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and dhammas that are without applied thought and without sustained thought are related to a dhamma that is without applied thought and without sustained thought as condition by way of condition being by way of mutual condition.

original: paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe avitakkavicāramattā khandhā ca vicāro ca vatthussa aññamaññapaccayena
analyzed: paccaya upaṭisandhi kkhaṇe avitakka vicāra mattā khandhā ca vicāro ca vatthussa aññamañña paccayena
translated: At the consciousness moment of rebirth, the aggregates that are accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought, and applied thought, and the physical basis are related to the physical basis as condition by way of condition being by way of mutual condition.

original: paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe avitakkavicāramattā khandhā ca vatthu ca vicārassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe avitakka vicāra mattā khandhā ca vatthu ca vicārassa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: At the consciousness moment of rebirth, the aggregates that are accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought, and the physical basis are related to applied thought as condition by way of condition being by way of mutual condition.

original: Avitakkavicāramatto ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā avitakkavicāramattassa ca avitakkaavicārassa
analyzed: avitakka vicāra matto ca avitakka avicāro ca dhammā avitakka vicāra mattassa ca avitakka avicārassa
translated: Dhammas that are accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and dhammas that are without applied thought and without sustained thought are related to a dhamma that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and to a dhamma that is without applied thought and without sustained thought as condition by way of condition being by way of mutual condition.

original: ca dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe avitakkavicāramatto eko
analyzed: ca dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccaya upaṭisandhi kkhaṇe a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ ekaḥ
translated: and of the mental factors, each other, as condition by way of conditionality.

original: khandho ca vicāro ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: khandho ca vicāraḥ ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: and of the mental factors, each other condition by way of condition by way of mutual dependence. At the time of rebirth-linking, the single constituent that is without thought and with only investigation🔽is a condition, by way of condition by way of mutual dependence, for the three constituents and for the physical basis.

original: …pe… dve khandhā ca vicāro ca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena🔽paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe avitakkavicāramatto eko khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ
analyzed: pe dve khandhā ca vicāro ca dvinnam khandhānam vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena  paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe avitakka vicāra mattaḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vatthu ca
translated: … and so on … The two constituents and investigation are a condition, by way of condition by way of mutual dependence, for the two constituents and for the physical basis.🔽At the time of rebirth-linking, the single constituent that is without thought and with only investigation is a condition, by way of condition by way of mutual dependence, for the three constituents and for investigation. … and so on … The two constituents and the physical basis

original: khandhānaṁ vicārassa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā ca vatthu ca🔽dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ vicārassa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.🔽Savitakkasavicāro ca avitakkavicāramatto ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa dhammassa
analyzed: khandhānam vicārassa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā ca vatthu ca  dvinnam khandhānam vicārassa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ  sa vitakka sa vicāro ca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa dhammassa
translated: are a condition, by way of condition by way of mutual dependence, for the two constituents and for investigation.

original: aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—savitakkasavicāro eko khandho ca vitakko ca tiṇṇannaṁ
analyzed: aññamañña paccayena paccaya usa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vitakko ca
translated: The mental factors that are with thought and with investigation and the mental factors that are without thought and with only investigation are a condition, by way of condition by way of mutual dependence, for the mental factors that are with thought and with investigation. original: khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā ca vitakko ca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: khandhānaṃ aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā ca vitakko ca dvinnam khandhānam
translated: Conditioned by the other aggregates, the mental factors of applied thought and sustained thought are a condition, as conascence condition, for two aggregates …🔽🔽Conditioned by two aggregates and the mental factors of applied thought and sustained thought,

original: aññamaññapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe
translated: The other four aggregates are related to each other as condition by way of mutual dependence. … Two aggregates and applied thought are related to two aggregates as condition by way of mutual dependence. …🔽At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Savitakkasavicāro ca avitakkavicāramatto ca dhammā avitakkaavicārassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ca avitakka vicāra matto ca dhammā avitakka avicārassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena
translated: A state with applied thought and sustained thought is related to a state without applied thought and sustained thought as condition by way of mutual dependence. …

original: paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe savitakkasavicārā khandhā ca vitakko ca vatthussa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.🔽Savitakkasavicāro ca avitakkavicāramatto ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa ca avitakkaavicārassa🔽ca dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe savitakkasavicāro eko khandho🔽ca vitakko ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve
analyzed: paccaya upaṭisandhi khaṇe sa vitakka sa vicārā khandhā ca vitakko ca vatthussa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ  sa vitakka sa vicāro ca avitakka vicāra matto ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa ca avitakka avicārassa  ca dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccaya upaṭisandhi kkhaṇe sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ekaḥ khandho  ca vitakko ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking, the aggregates with applied thought and sustained thought and applied thought are related to the physical basis as condition by way of mutual dependence.🔽A state with applied thought and sustained thought and a state without applied thought but with sustained thought are related to a state with applied thought and sustained thought and to a state without applied thought and sustained thought as condition by way of mutual dependence. …

original: khandhā ca vitakko ca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ vatthussa ca aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhā ca vitakko ca dvinnam khandhānam vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking, one of the aggregates with applied thought and sustained thought and applied thought are related to the three aggregates and to the physical basis as condition by way of mutual dependence. … Two aggregates and applied thought are related to two aggregates and to the physical basis as condition by way of mutual dependence.

original: Savitakkasavicāro ca avitakkavicāramatto ca avitakkaavicāro ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa🔽dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe savitakkasavicāro eko khandho🔽ca vitakko ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāro ca avitakka vicāra matto ca avitakka avicāro ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa  dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccaya upaṭisandhi kkhaṇe sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ekaḥ khandho  ca vitakko ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve
translated: States that are accompanied by applied and sustained thought and states that are without applied thought but with sustained thought and states that are without applied and sustained thought are reciprocally related as conditions for states that are accompanied by applied and sustained thought.🔽At the moment of rebirth-linking, one of the aggregates that is accompanied by applied and sustained thought and applied thought and the physical basis are reciprocally related as conditions for the three aggregates. … Two …

original: khandhā ca vitakko ca vatthu ca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhā ca vitakko ca vatthu ca dvinnam khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state with thinking and exploring is related to a state with thinking and exploring, and to a state without thinking but with exploring, and to a state without thinking and without exploring, as a condition by way of mutuality condition. At the time of rebirth-linking, one of the aggregates with thinking and exploring, and thinking, and the physical basis, are related to the three aggregates as a condition by way of mutuality condition. … Two of the aggregates, and thinking, and the physical basis, are related to the two aggregates as a condition by way of mutuality condition.

original: Nissaya
analyzed: nissaya
translated: Support

original: Savitakkasavicāro dhammo savitakkasavicārassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo—savitakkasavicāro eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ (saṅkhittaṁ) satta.🔽Avitakkavicāramatto dhammo avitakkavicāramattassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo (saṅkhittaṁ) pañca.
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakka sa vicārassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayo sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ ekaḥ khandho tiṇṇannam khandhānam saṅkhitta satta  a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammaḥ a vitakka vicāra mattassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pañca
translated: A state with thinking and exploring is related to a state with thinking and exploring as a condition by way of support condition: a state with thinking and exploring is related to three aggregates as a condition by way of support condition … (abbreviated) … seven.🔽A state without thinking but with exploring is related to a state without thinking but with exploring as a condition by way of support condition … (abbreviated) … five.

original: Avitakkaavicāro dhammo avitakkaavicārassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo— avitakkaavicāro
analyzed: avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ avitakka avicārassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ avitakka avicāraḥ
translated: A state without thinking and without exploring is related to a state without thinking and without exploring as a condition by way of support condition: a state without thinking and without exploring is related to the four immaterial aggregates as a condition by way of support condition.

original: eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo🔽…pe… dve khandhā dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ nissayapaccayena
analyzed: ekaḥ khandhaḥ tiṇṇannam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ  pe dve khandhā dvinnam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam nissaya paccayena
translated: One aggregate is a condition, as support condition, for three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.🔽… Two aggregates are a condition, as support condition, for two aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.🔽Applied thought is a condition, as support condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: paccayo. Vicāro cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe🔽avitakkaavicāro eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ nissayapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ vicāraḥ citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe  avitakka avicāraḥ ekaḥ khandhaḥ tiṇṇannam khandhānam kaṭattā ca rūpānam nissaya paccayena
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking🔽one aggregate is a condition, as support condition, for three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality due to kamma performed.

original: paccayo …pe… dve khandhā dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ …pe… asaññasattānaṁ ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe…🔽cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa …pe… vatthu avitakkaavicārānaṁ
analyzed: paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā dvinnam khandhānam pe asaññasattānam ekam mahābhūtam pe  cakkhu āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa pe vatthu
translated: … Two aggregates are a condition, as support condition, for two aggregates and for the kinds of materiality due to kamma performed. … For the non-percipient beings one great primary is a condition, as support condition, for the other three great primaries and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: khandhānaṁ vicārassa ca nissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhānam vicārassa ca nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The eye base is a condition, as support condition, for eye-consciousness and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness. … The body base is a condition, as support condition, for body-consciousness and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness. … The physical heart-basis is a condition, as support condition, for the three remaining immaterial aggregates and for applied thought.

original: Avitakkaavicāro dhammo savitakkasavicārassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo—vatthu savitakkasavicārānaṁ khandhānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu …pe….🔽Avitakkaavicāro dhammo avitakkavicāramattassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo—vicāro🔽avitakkavicāramattānaṁ khandhānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo, vatthu avitakkavicāramattānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ vitakkassa ca nissayapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe vicāro …pe….
analyzed: avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakka sa vicārassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ vatthu sa vitakka sa vicārānam khandhānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu pe  avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ avitakka vicāra mattassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ vicāraḥ  a vitakka vicāra mattānam khandhānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ vatthu  khandhānam vitakkassa ca nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe vicāraḥ pe
